week3.practice1_html:
Jeanne, your shedding has peaked and is stable now—this is the bridge between “holding steady” and letting regrowth start 🌱. But with heavy periods (iron risk), late caffeine, alcohol nights, and stress-eating, your mornings often begin on the back foot. A high‑protein, low‑inflammatory breakfast is the domino that steadies cortisol, fills iron/protein needs, and sets the stage for baby hairs to finally show in your next phase.

What to do

  • Aim for ~25–30 g protein within 1 hour of waking.
  • Pair protein with slow carbs + healthy fat to keep blood sugar stable.
  • Keep options fast, 5–10 min max (so stress or groggy mornings don’t derail you).
  • Rotate vegan + omnivore options so it feels fresh and not restrictive.

Your plan

  • Omnivore ideas: Greek yogurt bowl with berries + pumpkin seeds; 2 eggs + avocado on wholegrain toast; smoked salmon rice cakes with cucumber.
  • Vegan ideas: Protein smoothie (pea or soy powder, spinach, frozen banana, nut butter); chickpea scramble + salsa; overnight oats + hemp hearts + soy milk.
  • Batch-prep 2 weekday options so you just grab + go.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Set your wake window (even on weekends, ±30 min).
  2. Drink water before coffee to cut the urge for emotional‑eating “quick sugar.”
  3. Choose your prepped breakfast—aim to eat before that first caffeine hit (especially since you often sip after 3 pm).
  4. Add an iron‑friend: pumpkin seeds, spinach, or salmon—gentle insurance given your heavy periods.
  5. On alcohol mornings, lean extra on steady protein + greens to blunt cortisol spikes.

Why this works (for you)

  • Protein first → steadier cortisol, less mid‑morning crash → fewer hairs pushed into telogen.
  • Because your July stress trigger is ongoing, food stability lowers the “background noise” of cortisol, moving you faster toward regrowth.
  • Added protein + iron sources give follicles the raw material to thicken shafts once stabilization tips toward new growth.
  • Smoother mornings lessen emotional eating patterns that otherwise fuel inflammation and shedding.

What to look out for

  • Red flags: Skipping breakfast → afternoon sugar/alcohol cravings spike → more night waking. If this repeats, re‑name your backup breakfast option and prep it nightly.
  • Green lights: By week 2 you need less mid‑morning caffeine; steadier energy through your cycle; noticing less clump shedding on wash days.
  • You don’t have to be perfect, Jeanne ❤️—two solid protein breakfasts most weekdays already start nudging you from “stable” toward “regrowth start.”
week3.practice1_title: Practice 1: Win Your Day with Breakfast
